name: Endpoints Registry
description: An impl of the endpoints spec

binding.name: binding
binding.description: Endpoint message binding identifier. If set, all definitions MUST use this binding value

authorization.name: authorization
authorization.description: Authorization options. These are hints for the adapter for interacting with the authorization endpoint. This is not a credentials configuration

authorityuri.name: authorityuri
authorityuri.description: The authority uri where authorization shall be requested (if applicable)

granttypes.name: granttypes
granttypes.description: The grant types that can be requested (if applicable)

resourceurl.name: resourceurl
resourceurl.description: The resource uri for which authorization shall be granted (if applicable)

type.name: type
type.description: The authentication/authorization type. OAuth2, Plain, APIKey, and X509Cert are well-defined

deployed.name: deployed
deployed.description: If `true`, the endpoint metadata represents a public, live endpoint that is available for communication and a strict validator MAY test the liveness of the endpoint

endpoints.name: endpoints
endpoints.description: The network addresses that are for communication with the endpoint. The endpoints are ordered by preference, with the first endpoint being the preferred endpoint. Some protocol implementations might not support multiple endpoints, in which case all but the first endpoint might be ignored. Whether the URI just identifies a network host or links directly to a resource managed by the network host is protocol specific

connectionproperties.name: connectionproperties
connectionproperties.description: An optional map of AMQP connection properties to use with the endpoint

distributionmode.name: distributionmode
distributionmode.description: The AMQP distribution mode for receivers. Can be 'move' or 'copy'.  A value of 'move' indicates an exclusive lock on the message. A value of 'copy' indicates a non-exclusive lock on the message

durable.name: durable
durable.description: The AMQP durable flag. Whether the node is durable or transient

linkproperties.name: linkproperties
linkproperties.description: An optional map of AMQP link properties to use with the endpoint

node.name: node
node.description: The AMQP node name. Commonly the name of a queue or a topic

options.name: options
options.description: HTTP options. These apply to all HTTP versions since the application model is the same across versions

headers.name: headers
headers.description: HTTP headers to use with the endpoint. The same header may be specified multiple times with different values. The HTTP header names are case insensitive

acks.name: acks
acks.description: The Apache Kafka acks setting to use. If no acks setting is specified, the default is -1

consumergroup.name: consumergroup
consumergroup.description: The Apache Kafka consumer group name to use for consumers

headers.name: headers
headers.description: The Apache Kafka headers for publishers on this endpoint

partition.name: partition
partition.description: The Apache Kafka partition number to use when writing to or receiving from Apache Kafka

cleansession.name: cleansession
cleansession.description: The MQTT clean session flag to use for publishers on this endpoint

qos.name: qos
qos.description: The MQTT QoS level√∂. May be 0, 1, or 2

retain.name: retain
retain.description: The MQTT retain flag to use for publishers on ths endpoint

willmessage.name: willmessage
willmessage.description: The MQTT will message definition to configure for publishers on this endpoint

willtopic.name: willtopic
willtopic.description: The MQTT will topic to configure for publishers on this endpoint

cleansession.name: cleansession
cleansession.description: The MQTT clean session flag to use for publishers on this endpoint

qos.name: qos
qos.description: The MQTT QoS level. May be 0, 1, or 2

retain.name: retain
retain.description: The MQTT retain flag to use for publishers on ths endpoint

willmessage.name: willmessage
willmessage.description: The MQTT will message definition to configure for publishers on this endpoint

willtopic.name: willtopic
willtopic.description: The MQTT will topic to configure for publishers on this endpoint

format.name: format
format.description: Endpoint metadata format identifier. If set, all definitions MUST use this format value

messagegroups.name: messagegroups
messagegroups.description: The message groups that are supported by this endpoint

usage.name: usage
usage.description: Client's expected usage of this endpoint

basemessageurl.name: basemessageurl
basemessageurl.description: Reference to a base definition for this definition, either via a (relative) URL or a fragment identifier. The base definition is overridden by this definition. If not present, this definition does not override any base definition

binding.name: binding
binding.description: Binding identifier. This attribute MUST be the same as the 'binding' attribute of the definition group, but is not automatically inherited because definitions may be cross-referenced across groups

required.name: required
required.description: Whether the message annotation is required

path.name: path
path.description: The HTTP path as a uri template

message.name: message
message.description: The Apache Kafka message metadata constraints

format.name: format
format.description: Message format identifier. This attribute MUST be the same as the 'format' attribute of the definition group, but is not automatically inherited because definitions may be cross-referenced across groups

dataschema.name: dataschema
dataschema.description: The uri of the schema that the event payload adheres to. If the dataschema attribute is not present, it MUST be interpreted as no schema. An application MAY assign a meaning to the dataschema attribute if it is not present by default

time.name: time
time.description: The timestamp of when the event happened

schema.name: schema
schema.description: The inline schema for the message payload, equivalent to the 'schema' attribute of the schema registry

schemaformat.name: schemaformat
schemaformat.description: The schema format applicable to the message payload, equivalent to the 'format' attribute attribute of the schema registry

schemaobject.name: schemaobject
schemaobject.description: The inline schema object for the message payload, equivalent to the 'schemaobject' attribute of the schema registry

schemauri.name: schemauri
schemauri.description: The URL of the schema for the message payload, equivalent to the 'schemaurl' attribute of the schema registry
